org.latency4j

Class CappedLatencyRequirement

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.LatencyRequirement
      • org.latency4j.CappedLatencyRequirement

  • public class CappedLatencyRequirement
extends LatencyRequirement

    Representation of a capped latency requirement.

    A capped requirement is one where a fixed upper bound is specified for task latency.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Method Detail

      • getExpectedLatency

        public java.lang.Long getExpectedLatency()

        Returns the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that a unit of execution falling within the work category is expected to take. Where the duration of an execution exceeds this limit, all monitors watching this requirement are required to issue a notification to indicate so.

        Returns:
        The latency limit for work which is covered by this requirement. Note that if this value was not explicitly set, it defaults to DEFAULT_EXPECTED_LATENCY.
        See Also:
        AlertHandler.latencyExceededCap(CappedLatencyRequirement, WorkDuration)

      • setExpectedLatency

        public void setExpectedLatency(java.lang.Long expectedLatency)

        Sets the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) that a unit of execution falling within the work category covered by this requirement is expected to take.

        Parameters:
        expectedLatency - The maximum expected/allowed/tolerable latency for execution which falls within the category of work covered by this requirement. This value must be greater than zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the specified expected latency is less than or equal to 0.
        See Also:
        getExpectedLatency()
